STEP A | Prep

Glue the fence-back x3 pieces together. Let dry.
Glue the top x2 pieces together. Let dry.



STEP B | Template

Use the paper template provided with the router plate to make a wood template. Position the wood template centered on the prepared top.
Trace the wood template opening onto the top and remove.



STEP C | Inner Opening

Drill a hole in the center of the top in the traced opening.
Starting from the center hole, use a jigsaw to rough out the opening.2
Replace the wood template and use a router with a template bit to clean up the opening
Remove the template

2 attempt to get as close as possible to the traced opening without touching

STEP D | Outter Opening

Set the router depth to just past the thickness of the router plate.3
Use a router with a rabbet bit to route out the pocket for the router plate.

3 leveling pins will bring this flush

STEP E | Channel

Route out the dovetail tracks in the top positioned 19 mm away from both edges of the router plate
